intro: Riedelia longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled riedelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. Riedelia longisepala thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
